message.content:
cs.DB, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.CR

This paper presents a technique for query evaluation in probabilistic databases, which falls under the category of database systems (cs.DB). The technique involves compiling expressions into decomposition trees, which can be seen as a form of knowledge representation and reasoning, thus also fitting into the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of semirings and semimodules in the technique suggests a connection to linear algebra and machine learning, which are subfields of both artificial intelligence and theoretical computer science (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the tractability of queries, which is a topic in computational complexity theory (cs.CR). Finally, the performance experiments with custom datasets and TPC-H data suggest a connection to data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
